template.name: Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP
template.description:
The template to monitor SAN Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by Zabbix SNMP agent.
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/418855-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-huawei-oceanstor
Template tooling version used: 0.41

trigger.expression: last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/huawei.5300.v5[version],#1)<>last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/huawei.5300.v5[version],#2) and length(last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/huawei.5300.v5[version]))>0
trigger.name: OceanStor 5300 V5: Storage version has been changed
trigger.event_name: OceanStor 5300 V5: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: OceanStor 5300 V5 version has changed. Ack to close.

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototype.name: BBU {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Health status
item_prototype.description: Health status of a BBU. For details, see definition of Enum Values (HEALTH_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: BBU {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Health status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: BBU {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Running status
item_prototype.description: Running status of a BBU. For details, see definition of Enum Values (RUNNING_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: BBU {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Running status is not Online

item_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: CPU usage of a controller {#ID}.

trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Health status
item_prototype.description: Controller health status. For details, see definition of Enum Values (HEALTH_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Health status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Memory utilization
item_prototype.description: Memory usage of a controller {#ID}.

trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Memory usage is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: Controller {#ID}: Memory usage is too high (over {$HUAWEI.5300.MEM.MAX.WARN} for {$HUAWEI.5300.MEM.MAX.TIME})

item_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Role
item_prototype.description: Controller role..

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/huawei.5300.v5[hwInfoControllerRole, "{#ID}"],#1)<>last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/huawei.5300.v5[hwInfoControllerRole, "{#ID}"],#2)
trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Role has been changed

item_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Running status
item_prototype.description: Controller running status. For details, see definition of Enum Values (RUNNING_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#ID}: Running status is not Online

item_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Health score
item_prototype.description: Health score of a disk. If the value is 255, indicating invalid.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Health status
item_prototype.description: Disk health status. For details, see definition of Enum Values (HEALTH_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Health status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Running status
item_prototype.description: Disk running status. For details, see definition of Enum Values (RUNNING_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Running status is not Online

item_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: Disk temperature.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Temperature is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: Disk {#MODEL} on {#LOCATION}: Temperature is too high (over {$HUAWEI.5300.DISK.TEMP.MAX.WARN:"{#MODEL}"} for {$HUAWEI.5300.DISK.TEMP.MAX.TIME})

item_prototype.name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Health status
item_prototype.description: Enclosure health status. For details, see definition of Enum Values (HEALTH_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Health status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Running status
item_prototype.description: Enclosure running status. For details, see definition of Enum Values (RUNNING_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Running status is not Online

item_prototype.name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: Enclosure temperature.

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Temperature is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: Enclosure {#NAME}: Temperature is too high (over {$HUAWEI.5300.TEMP.MAX.WARN} for {$HUAWEI.5300.TEMP.MAX.TIME})

item_prototype.name: FAN {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Health status
item_prototype.description: Health status of a fan. For details, see definition of Enum Values (HEALTH_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: FAN {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Health status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: FAN {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Running status
item_prototype.description: Operating status of a fan. For details, see definition of Enum Values (RUNNING_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: FAN {#ID} on {#LOCATION}: Running status is not Running

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Average total I/O latency
item_prototype.description: Average I/O latency of the node in milliseconds.

trigger_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Average I/O response time is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: LUN {#NAME}: Average I/O response time is too high (over {$HUAWEI.5300.LUN.IO.TIME.MAX.WARN}ms for {$HUAWEI.5300.LUN.IO.TIME.MAX.TIME})

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Average read I/O latency
item_prototype.description: Average read I/O response time in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Average write I/O latency
item_prototype.description: Average write I/O response time in milliseconds.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Read operations per second
item_prototype.description: Read IOPS of the node.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Read traffic per second
item_prototype.description: Current read bandwidth for the LUN.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Total I/O per second
item_prototype.description: Current IOPS of the LUN.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Total traffic per second
item_prototype.description: Current total bandwidth for the LUN.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Write operations per second
item_prototype.description: Write IOPS of the node.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Write traffic per second
item_prototype.description: Current write bandwidth for the LUN.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Capacity
item_prototype.description: Capacity of the LUN.

item_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Status
item_prototype.description: Status of the LUN.

trigger_prototype.name: LUN {#NAME}: Status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: CPU usage of the node {#NODE}.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Average I/O latency
item_prototype.description: Average I/O latency of the node.

trigger_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Average I/O latency is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: Node {#NODE}: Average I/O latency is too high (over {$HUAWEI.5300.NODE.IO.DELAY.MAX.WARN}ms for {$HUAWEI.5300.NODE.IO.DELAY.MAX.TIME})

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Read operations per second
item_prototype.description: Read IOPS of the node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Read traffic per second
item_prototype.description: Read bandwidth for the node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Total I/O per second
item_prototype.description: Total IOPS of the node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Total traffic per second
item_prototype.description: Total bandwidth for the node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Write operations per second
item_prototype.description: Write IOPS of the node.

item_prototype.name: Node {#NODE}: Write traffic per second
item_prototype.description: Write bandwidth for the node.

item_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Capacity free
item_prototype.description: Available capacity of a storage pool.

item_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Capacity used percentage
item_prototype.description: Used capacity of a storage pool in percents.

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Used capacity is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: Pool {#NAME}: Used capacity is too high (over {#THRESHOLD}%)

item_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Health status
item_prototype.description: Health status of a storage pool. For details, see definition of Enum Values (HEALTH_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Health status is not Normal

item_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Running status
item_prototype.description: Operating status of a storage pool. For details, see definition of Enum Values (RUNNING_STATUS_E). https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/centralized-storage/oceanstor-5300-v5-pid-22462029?category=reference-guides&subcategory=mib-reference

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Running status is not Online

item_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Capacity used
item_prototype.description: Used capacity of a storage pool.

item_prototype.name: Pool {#NAME}: Capacity total
item_prototype.description: Total capacity of a storage pool.

macro.description: The critical threshold of the CPU utilization in %.
The time during which temperature of disk may exceed the threshold.
Maximum temperature of disk. Can be used with {#MODEL} as context.
The time during which average I/O response time of LUN may exceed the threshold.
Maximum average I/O response time of LUN in milliseconds.
The time during which memory usage may exceed the threshold.
The time during which average I/O latency of node may exceed the threshold.
Maximum average I/O latency of node in milliseconds.
The time during which free capacity may exceed the {#THRESHOLD} from hwInfoStoragePoolFullThreshold.
The time during which temperature of enclosure may exceed the threshold.

trigger.expression: (last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/Huawei OceanStor 5300 V5 by SNMP/system.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Host has been restarted
